titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Carmel Bach Festival Tape Collection ARS.0025
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Andrea Castillo

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2010-02-03T15:24-0800

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Carmel Bach Festival Tape Collection

physdesc.extent: 190 open reel audio tapes and 20 audiocassettes

did.physdesc: 190 open reel audio tapes and 20 audiocassettes

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Listening appointments may require 24 hours notice. Contact Archive Operations Manager.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact Head Librarian of the Archive of Recorded Sound.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection's 210 tapes are recordings of the yearly Carmel summer concerts conducted by Sandor Salgo. The concerts' repertoire consist primarily of Johann Sebastian Bach's music and his contemporaries, and secondarily of Renaissance, Romantic and 20th century music.
